AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.jury in United States v. Maria De Jesus: deliberating body in the court case against Maria De Jesus Garcia, having difficulty reaching a unanimous decision after approximately two hours of deliberation, eventually returning a guilty verdict
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: court case involving allegations against Maria De Jesus Garcia, with a focus on the modified Allen charge and its potential coercive effect on the jury, resulting in a guilty verdict
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a court case involving allegations of smuggling undocumented aliens, arguing against the use of the modified Allen charge, seeking post-verdict discovery through juror depositions and interrogatories to determine potential coercion by the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.modified Allen charge: a judicial instruction given to the jury in United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia, emphasizing the importance of reaching a verdict, with its potential coercive effect being a point of contention, used after the jury reported being deadlocked
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper: vehicle used for smuggling undocumented aliens on Interstate Highway 35, characterized by heavy loading and difficulty in handling, subject of a suppression motion regarding evidence obtained during its stop and search
